arrowPadding.description:
The padding required to prevent the arrow from
reaching the very edge of the popper.

autoSelect.description:
If `true`, the first enabled menu item will receive focus and be selected
when the menu opens.

boundary.description: The boundary area for the popper. Used within the `preventOverflow` modifier

breakpoints.description: The breakpoints to use for the responsive menu.

children.type: string | number | boolean | ReactElement<any, string | JSXElementConstructor<any>> | Iterable<ReactNode> | ReactPortal | PromiseLikeOfReactNode | ((props: { ...; }) => ReactNode)

closeOnBlur.description:
If `true`, the menu will close when you click outside
the menu list

closeOnSelect.description:
If `true`, the menu will close when a menu item is
clicked

direction.description:
If `rtl`, proper placement positions will be flipped i.e. 'top-right' will
become 'top-left' and vice-verse

eventListeners.description:
If provided, determines whether the popper will reposition itself on `scroll`
and `resize` of the window.

flip.description:
If `true`, the popper will change its placement and flip when it's
about to overflow its boundary area.

gutter.description:
The distance or margin between the reference and popper.
It is used internally to create an `offset` modifier.

NB: If you define `offset` prop, it'll override the gutter.

initialFocusRef.description: The `ref` of the element that should receive focus when the popover opens.

isLazy.description:
Performance ðŸš€:
If `true`, the MenuItem rendering will be deferred
until the menu is open.

lazyBehavior.description:
Performance ðŸš€:
The lazy behavior of menu's content when not visible.
Only works when `isLazy={true}`

- "unmount": The menu's content is always unmounted when not open.
- "keepMounted": The menu's content initially unmounted,
but stays mounted when menu is open.

matchWidth.description:
If `true`, the popper will match the width of the reference at all times.
It's useful for `autocomplete`, `date-picker` and `select` patterns.

modifiers.description:
Array of popper.js modifiers. Check the docs to see
the list of possible modifiers you can pass.

offset.description:
The main and cross-axis offset to displace popper element
from its reference element.

placement.description: The placement of the popper relative to its reference.

preventOverflow.description:
If `true`, will prevent the popper from being cut off and ensure
it's visible within the boundary area.

strategy.description: The CSS positioning strategy to use.

label.type:
type ONLY_FOR_FORMAT =
  | string
  | number
  | boolean
  | ReactElement<any, string | JSXElementConstructor<any>>
  | Iterable<ReactNode>
  | ReactPortal
  | PromiseLikeOfReactNode

value.type:
type ONLY_FOR_FORMAT =
  | string
  | number
  | boolean
  | ReactElement<any, string | JSXElementConstructor<any>>
  | Iterable<ReactNode>
  | ReactPortal
  | PromiseLikeOfReactNode

errorBorderColor.description: The border color when the input is invalid. Use color keys in `theme.colors`

focusBorderColor.description: The border color when the input is focused. Use color keys in `theme.colors`

htmlSize.description: The native HTML `size` attribute to be passed to the `input`

isDisabled.description:
If `true`, the form control will be disabled. This has 2 side effects:
- The `FormLabel` will have `data-disabled` attribute
- The form element (e.g, Input) will be disabled

isInvalid.description:
If `true`, the form control will be invalid. This has 2 side effects:
- The `FormLabel` and `FormErrorIcon` will have `data-invalid` set to `true`
- The form element (e.g, Input) will have `aria-invalid` set to `true`

isReadOnly.description: If `true`, the form control will be readonly

isRequired.description:
If `true`, the form control will be required. This has 2 side effects:
- The `FormLabel` will show a required indicator
- The form element (e.g, Input) will have `aria-required` set to `true`
